Description: Reconstructed painted pottery Fikellura neck-amphora (Altenburg Painter). On shoulder ivy leaves on stalks; on each side of the body is a nude male figure in archaic running attitude; on each side of the handles is a palmette with volutes, below a band of crescents.
Curator's comments: Incorporated with BM GR 1888,0208.56j & 1924,1201.1095 (1888,0208.56k re-registered). CVA British Museum 8 (Detail of A on Pl. GB 581, 9: Pl. GB 579, 3 is of B.) Perhaps the neck Pl. GB 575, 10 belongs to this pot. Boehlau no. 14. BSA xxxiv, 16 (J 6), 17, 66, 74, 79; pl. 7a.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B120)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 579, 3 (and GB 581, 9))
Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 62 § 59, p. 63 § 60, pl. xxviii, 3, 3a, 3b)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 196)
Condition: Missing neck, handles, foot, various fragments.
